generalTips: Get a JR Pass for the Shinkansen and JR trains - saves money on the Tokyo-Kyoto journey
Buy IC cards (Suica or ICOCA) for each family member for easy metro/train payments
Download Google Maps offline for each city before you go
Most restaurants can accommodate vegetarian requests - say 'yasai dake' (vegetables only)
Convenience stores (7-Eleven, Lawson) have great vegetarian onigiri for quick snacks
Kids eat free or half-price at most attractions under 12
Takkyubin luggage forwarding is a lifesaver with kids - send bags ahead to next hotel
Temple etiquette: bow at gates, walk on sides (not center), and be quiet inside
Deer at Nara bow back when you bow to them - teach the kids before you go!
Many places are cash-only - carry yen with you
